text.text: How do you merge incomplete claims in ZOLL Billing?

text: To merge incomplete claims in ZOLL Billing, you can: 1. Review the information. 2. If the imported claim is a duplicate of an existing claim, click "Yes, merge this claim". 3. If it is not, click "No, create a new claim".

text.text: Can you explain the process of merging imported claims with existing incomplete claims in ZOLL Billing?

text: To merge imported claims with existing incomplete claims in ZOLL Billing, you can: 1. Review the information. 2. If the imported claim is a duplicate of an existing claim, click "Yes, merge this claim". 3. If it is not, click "No, create a new claim".

text.text: What happens when you merge an imported claim with an existing incomplete claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you merge an imported claim with an existing incomplete claim, the system makes modifications to the incomplete claim. The status of the import record for the new claim is updated to "Not imported: merged into existing claim" with a link to the existing claim.

text.text: What steps are involved in changing the loaded mileage and base rate units after merging claims by mistake in ZOLL Billing?

text: To undo the modifications and import the claim again, you need to: 1. On the incomplete claim: 2. Change the loaded mileage back to the original amount 3. Decrease the amount of the base rate Units by one 4. Remove unwanted attachments.

text.text: Can you describe how to remove unwanted attachments from an incomplete claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: To delete an attachment, click the X under the "Delete" column.

text.text: What does the system look at to determine if an imported NEMSIS file has been previously imported in ZOLL Billing?

text: The system looks at the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to determine if the file has been previously imported. If it has never seen this value before, a claim is created. If this value is not unique (this file was already imported), then a message displays on the Import Claims page that reads "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim". This is important to note as you will have to modify the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to successfully re-import the file into ZOLL Billing.

text.text: How can you modify the eRecord.01 value in a NEMSIS file to successfully re-import it into ZOLL Billing?

text: To modify the eRecord.01 value, you need to open the NEMSIS file and hit Ctrl F and then type eRecord.01. You will find the value under <PatientCareReport>.

text.text: Can you clarify how to locate and modify the eRecord.01 value in a NEMSIS file for re-importing in ZOLL Billing?

text: To modify the eRecord.01 value, you need to open the NEMSIS file and hit Ctrl F and then type eRecord.01. You will find the value under <PatientCareReport>.

text.text: What is the significance of ensuring the eRecord.01 value is unique when re-importing a NEMSIS file in ZOLL Billing?

text: The eRecord.01 value must be unique so try adding a character or letter to the beginning or end of the eRecord.01 name. In the example above we added a "6" to the end of "Yargh".

text.text: Can you explain the importance of unique eRecord.01 values in ZOLL Billing's claim import process?

text: If the eRecord.01 value is not unique (this file was already imported), then a message displays on the Import Claims page that reads "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim.

text.text: How can you save and import a modified NEMSIS file into ZOLL Billing after changing the eRecord.01 value?

text: The system looks at the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to determine if the file has been previously imported.

text.text: What action should you take if a message displays "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim" when attempting to re-import a NEMSIS file in ZOLL Billing?

text: To undo those modifications and import the claim again you will need to: 1. On the incomplete claim: a. Change the loaded mileage back to the original amount b. Decrease the amount of the base rate Units by one c. Remove unwanted attachments 2. Re-importing the NEMSIS file: The system looks at the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to determine if the file has been previously imported. If it has never seen this value before, a claim is created. If this value is not unique (this file was already imported) then a message displays on the Import Claims page that reads "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of opening, modifying, and saving a NEMSIS file for re-importing in ZOLL Billing?

text: To change the eRecord.01 value, you need to open the NEMSIS file. You can then hit Ctrl F and then type eRecord.01. You will find the value under <PatientCareReport>.

text.text: What steps should be taken to ensure a successful re-import of a NEMSIS file in ZOLL Billing?

text: To successfully re-import a NEMSIS file into ZOLL Billing, you will have to modify the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file. The eRecord.01 value must be unique so try adding a character or letter to the beginning or end of the eRecord.01 name. In the example above we added a "6" to the end of "Yargh". You can then save the file and then import it into ZOLL Billing.

text.text: How to undo modifications and import the claim again?

text: To undo those modifications and import the claim again you will need to: 1. On the incomplete claim: a. Change the loaded mileage back to the original amount b. Decrease the amount of the base rate Units by one c. Remove unwanted attachments 2. Re-importing the NEMSIS file: The system looks at the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to determine if the file has been previously imported. If it has never seen this value before, a claim is created. If this value is not unique (this file was already imported) then a message displays on the Import Claims page that reads "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim.

text.text: How to change the eRecord.01 value?

text: To change the eRecord.01 value, you need to open the NEMSIS file. You can then hit Ctrl F and then type eRecord.01. You will find the value under <PatientCareReport>. The eRecord.01 value must be unique so try adding a character or letter to the beginning or end of the eRecord.01 name. In the example above we added a "6" to the end of "Yargh". You can then save the file and then import it into ZOLL Billing.
